results.title: First adaptations
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Time to grow”.
Outlines the degree to which infants are “pre-adapted” to respond to their environment, to allow survival, growth and learning. Brain development is also demonstrated.

results.title: Teja: a Sikh priest
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”
Describes the Indian Sikh community in Woolgoolga, in New South Wales, and Teja Singh, the community priest. Explores his role in the preservation of the culture, traditions and religion of the old life in India, and his view of the necessary changes and adaptations that the future will bring.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubetzki, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”
Describes the Indian Sikh community in Woolgoolga, in New South Wales, and Teja Singh, the community priest. Explores his role in the preservation of the culture, traditions and religion of the old life in India, and his view of the necessary changes and adaptations that the future will bring.

results.title: Great expectations
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Time to grow”.
Under a general discussion of parents’ expectations of their children, many diverse topics are covered: environment, change in family situation, premature babies and more.

results.title: Kemal: a Turkish boy
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Kemal is a Turkish-born youth at school in Sydney. He has been in Australia for two years. The film shows the difficulties he experiences, particularly as they relate to language. It also illustrates the cultural background of a child from Turkey which has a strong male-oriented order and where the Islam religion is dominant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Blagg, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Kemal is a Turkish-born youth at school in Sydney. He has been in Australia for two years. The film shows the difficulties he experiences, particularly as they relate to language. It also illustrates the cultural background of a child from Turkey which has a strong male-oriented order and where the Islam religion is dominant.

results.title: Jim Serafim goes to School
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A Greek child’s first day at school. Demonstrates the difficulties non-English speaking children and their parents have in their “new” country.

results.title: Contexts of development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses the theory of “context” where each child is unique (biological context), but part of the environment (immediate, socio-economic and cultural contexts).

results.title: George and Toula
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A portrait of a marriage within the Greek community. George is Greek-born and Toula second-generation Australian. Toula has had a tertiary education and works in social services. She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.

results.title: Child development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Time to grow”.
Introduces the series, defines developmental psychology, provides a brief historical overview, and poses many of the questions discussed in later programs.
